str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To bring to an end, fulfill, accomplish. From sun and teleo; to complete entirely; generally, to execute.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Or sugchuno from sun and cheo or its alternate; to commingle promiscuously, i.e. to throw into disorder, to perplex.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
